definition: A Gram-positive lancet-shaped diplococcus causing pneumonia and meningitis.
example or note: Optochin sensitive; capsule major virulence factor.

definition: A Gram-positive β-hemolytic streptococcus (Group A).
A Gram-positive β-hemolytic streptococcus (Group B).
example or note: Neonatal sepsis and meningitis; CAMP test positive.

definition: An oral streptococcus associated with dental caries.
japanese: ミュータンス連鎖球菌

definition: A Gram-positive coagulase-positive coccus forming grape-like clusters.
example or note: SSTI, sepsis, food poisoning; MRSA important.

definition: A Gram-positive coagulase-negative skin commensal.
A Gram-positive coagulase-negative coccus linked to UTIs.
A bile- and salt-tolerant Gram-positive coccus.
A Gram-positive coccus with high antimicrobial resistance.
A motile Gram-positive rod causing foodborne illness.
example or note: Grows at low temperatures; neonatal meningitis.

definition: A spore-forming Gram-positive rod causing food poisoning.
A spore-forming Gram-positive rod causing anthrax.
A club-shaped Gram-positive rod producing diphtheria toxin.
An anaerobic spore-forming Gram-positive rod.
An anaerobic spore-forming rod producing botulinum toxin.
An anaerobic rod producing tetanospasmin.
A facultative Gram-negative rod common in gut flora.
example or note: Includes EHEC, ETEC, UPEC; major UTI pathogen.

definition: A Gram-negative encapsulated rod causing pneumonia.
A Gram-negative rod with inducible AmpC.
A Gram-negative rod producing red pigment.
A motile Gram-negative rod with swarming growth.
A non-fermenting Gram-negative rod with pigments.
example or note: Highly resistant; causes pneumonia and sepsis.

definition: A non-fermenting Gram-negative coccobacillus.
A Gram-negative diplococcus causing meningitis.
A Gram-negative diplococcus causing gonorrhea.
A small Gram-negative rod requiring factors X/V.
example or note: Type b causes meningitis; NTHi common.

definition: A Gram-negative diplococcus causing airway infections.
A Gram-negative rod causing whooping cough.
A Gram-negative rod causing gastroenteritis and typhoid.
A non-motile Gram-negative rod causing dysentery.
example or note: Low infectious dose; shiga toxin possible.

definition: A curved microaerophilic Gram-negative rod.
A curved Gram-negative rod causing cholera.
example or note: Cholera toxin; grows in alkaline media.

definition: A spiral Gram-negative rod causing gastritis and ulcers.
